data.title: Albuquerque Journal Obituaries
data.text:
Obituary for CONNOLLY

CONNOLLY, BARBARA Age 65, a resident of Albuquerque, went home to be with the Lord Jesus, Thursday, March 21, 2013. She is survived by Vince and Stephanie M. of Albuquerque, NM. Barbara was preceded in death by her parents Walter and Marianna Connolly. Barbara was a member of Our Lady of Fatima Catholic Church. Barbara was a devout Catholic who loved the Lord. She was dearly loved and will be greatly missed by all who knew her. Rosary will be recited on Wednesday, April 3, 2013 at 9:30 a.m. with Mass to follow at 10:00 a.m. at Our Lady of Fatima Catholic Church, 4020 Lomas Blvd NE. Interment will be held at Mt. Calvary. Please visit our online guest book for Barbara at www.FrenchFunerals.com FRENCH 1111 University Blvd NE 505-843-6333

↧

↧

Obituary for WILLIAMS

WILLIAMS, NANCY (CRUZ) was born April 22, 1948, age 64, and a resident of Albuquerque, NM, departed this life to be with our Lord on Sunday, March 31, 2013. Nancy was preceded in death by her father, Abel Cruz; brother, Billy Cruz; niece, Christina Delgado and great-niece, Jennifer Maes. She is survived by her husband of 44 years Earl (Willie) Williams; son, Robert Williams of Las Cruces; daughters, Gloria Williams and Angel Duran of Albuquerque; grandchildren, Julian Joe-Duran and Joslyn Duran of Albuquerque; mother, Flora Cruz; sisters, Betty Delgado and Cenaida (Billy) Maes; brother, Abel (Jerri) Cruz as well as many nieces, nephews and friends who she held close to her heart. Nancy will be remembered for her gracious generosity and kind heart. She will be greatly missed by all and forever loved. A Rosary will be recited at St. Therese Catholic Church, 3424 4th St. NW, ABQ. on Thursday, April 11, 2013 at 7:00pm, with a reception to follow at St. Therese School cafeteria behind the church. Burial will take place on Friday, April 12, 2013 at Santa Fe National Cemetery, 501 N. Guadalupe St. Santa Fe, NM 87501 at 11:15am. The family wishes to thank the staff at Fresenius Dialysis Clinic on Gibson and Vista Care Hospice, especially Cori Hetzel, RN for the care they provided to Nancy. Direct Funeral Services, 2919 4th St. NW. ABQ. 505-343-8008.

↧

Obituary for TAPIA

TAPIA, ESTHER R. Loving wife, mother, daughter, grandmother, great- grandmother, great-great- grandmother, sister, aunt and friend, went home to be with our Lord and Savior on Saturday, April 6, 2013 at the age of 88. She was born in Cerrillos, NM to Frank and Carlotta Martinez. Esther adored her family and loved spending time with them. She was preceded in death by her loving husband of 71 years, Miguel Tapia, Lisa McGinley, Virginia Gallegos, Richard Tapia, Charlie Tapia, Johnie Tapia, Bennie Tapia, Beatrice Corriz, Betalia, and Billie Martinez. Esther is survived by her children Cruzita Tapia, Victoria Martinez, Charlotte and husband Richard Gonzales, Maria and husband David Campos, Nellie and husband Gilbert Artiaga, Chris Tapia, Oliver and wife Lucille Tapia, Randall and wife Terese Tapia and Anthony Tapia; 26 grandchildren; 37 great-grandchildren; 4 great- great- grandchildren; and numerous relatives and friends. Esther will be greatly missed by all who knew and loved her. A Visitation will take place at Garcia Mortuary ~ Chapel of Angels, Wednesday, April 10, 2013 from 5:00 pm to 7:00 pm followed by a reciting of the Rosary at 7:00 pm. Mass of Christian burial will be celebrated at Holy Family Church, 562 Atrisco Dr SW, Thursday, April 11, 2013 at 9:00 am; Interment will follow at Mount Calvary Cemetery. To view Service information or leave a condolence please visit www.danielsfuneral.com Garcia Mortuary 717 Stover Ave. SW Albuquerque, NM 87102 505-243-5222

↧

Obituary for QUINTANA

QUINTANA, RUDY SR. age 61, suddenly went to be with the Lord on Thursday April 4, 2013. He was preceded in death by his parents, Manuel and Lucilla Quintana. He is survived by his children, Rudy Jr., (Reve Martinez), April, Natasha (Michael) Johnathan; numerous grandchildren; lifelong companion Rosemary; brothers and sisters, Angie, Edwina, Margret, Lucille, Jeanette, Tim Quintana; and numerous nieces and nephews. Rudy was well known as a musician in Santa Fe playing the guitar as a Mariachi, a hard worker, joker, and an upbeat loving, caring and friendly man. We love you and will miss you greatly. A visitation will be held at 6:30pm followed by a Rosary at 7:00pm on Tuesday April 9, 2013 at St. Anne Parish, 511 Alicia St., Santa Fe, NM. Funeral Mass will be held at 1:00pm on Friday April 12, 2013 at St. Anne Parish. Interment is to follow. Please visit Rudy's online register book at www.salazarandsonsmortuary.com Services entrusted to SALAZAR & SONS MORTUARY 400 3RD St. SW Albuquerque, NM 87102 505-247-4124

↧

Obituary for PEREA

PEREA, ROY SALAS was born on August 5, 1922 in Madrid NM and passed away on Sunday, April 7, 2013 at the V.A.M.C. in ABQ. Roy honorably served in the U.S. Navy. He enjoyed dancing, animals, especially birds, taking long walks, talking with and meeting new people. Roy loved to joke and enjoy life. He was preceded in death by his wife, Jean Perea; two daughters, Gloria Jean Perea and Dolores Sanchez; grandson, Richard Roy Perea; great-grandson, Aaron Taylor. Roy is survived by his five children, Leroy Valles and wife, Kris, Victor Perea, Robert Perea and wife, Evelyn, Irene Trujillo and husband, Jack, Emily Gomez and husband, Silverio, all of ABQ; one brother; two sisters; many grandchildren, great-grandchildren; and other family and friends who loved and will miss him. Graveside Service will be held at the Santa Fe National Cemetery on Thursday, April 12, 2013 at 3:00pm with U.S. Navy Honors. Arrangements by Direct Funeral Services, 2919 4th St. N.W. ABQ. 505-343-8008.

↧

↧

Obituary for MELETANI

MELETANI, OLGA From Albuquerque, NM, was called home to be with our Lord on April 3, 2013 with family members by her side. She was born on November 11, 1925 in Bernalillo, New Mexico. Child of Christopher and Annie Meletani. She worked for several lumber companies in Albuquerque as an accountant and then moved with the lumber business where she settled in Sonora, California in 1948. She retired after 40 years of service and returned to Albuquerque in 2003 to be close to family. She is survived by her beloved "little sister" Enise Sandoval and her husband Louis Sandoval; nephew Chris and wife Carol; nieces Kathy and husband Bob, Anna and partner Clyde, Donna and "Baby". She also has six great-nephews and nieces; and five great-great-nephews and nieces. There will be a private service with her immediate family. Arrangements are being made through Riverside Funeral Home.

↧

Obituary for MAJESKIE

MAJESKIE, ELIZABETH R. Age 86 and a resident of Rio Rancho since 1977, passed away on Friday, April 5, 2013. She was born to Norman and Eva Widstrand on May 18, 1926 in Crystal Falls, MI. She was preceded in death by her husband, Robert (Bob), son, Richard, and daughter, Nadine Trimborn. Bette is survived by her children: Deborah Sullivan, Marlane Gabel Barton (Roger); Denice MacDonald; Gerard (Carolyn); Peggy Schofield (Ernest); and Melissa Stephens (Theo). She is, also survived by her grandchildren: Ryan, Scott, Daniel, Stephanie, Brian, Kelley, Katie, Angela, Jeremy, Kayla, and Kelli Anne; and her great-grandchildren: Mallory, Ethan, Jessika, and Isabella; as well as several nieces and nephews. Bette was a member of the American Legion Women's Auxiliary Post 118, Rio Rancho Elks Club and St. Thomas Aquinas Catholic Church. She was an avid reader of books; loved music, making boiled dinners, pasties and fudge for her family; playing bingo and spending time at the casino. Private Memorial Services will take place at a later date in WI where Bette will be interred next to her husband. In lieu of flowers, donations can be made in Bette's name to Smile Train, P.O. Box 96231, Washington, D.C. 20090. To view information or leave a condolence, please visit www.danielsfuneral.com Daniels Family Funeral Services 4310 Sara Road SE Rio Rancho, NM 87124 505-892-9920

↧

Obituary for KELLIS

KELLIS, IGNATIOS &Quot;JACK&Quot; Age 56, a lifelong resident of Albuquerque, passed away Sunday, April 7, 2013. He is survived by his sisters, Marianthe "Mary" Kellis Scanlan and husband, Kevin of San Diego, CA, and Olympia Kellis Katelanis of Novato, CA; nephew Gavin Scanlan; nieces Katelin Scanlan, Electra Katelanis, Eleni Katelanis, Eliana Katelanis and Emalia Katelanis. Jack was a member of St. George Greek Orthodox Church. Trisagion service will be held on Tuesday April 9, 2013, 5:45 pm at French - University, 1111 University Blvd NE, with Rev. Father Conan Gill officiating. Service will be held on Wednesday, April 10 at 10:00 am at St. George Greek Orthodox Church, 308 High Street SE, 87102. Interment will follow at Fairview Memorial Park, 700 Yale Blvd. Should friends desire, memorial contributions may be made to St. George Greek Orthodox Church, 308 High St. 87102. Please visit our online guest book for Jack at www.FrenchFunerals.com FRENCH - University 1111 University Blvd NE 505-843-6333

↧

Obituary for HIJAR

HIJAR, MARY ELLEN Age 74, found complete healing on April 5, 2013 and now rests in Heaven with the Lord Jesus Christ. She was born in Duran, NM on March 9, 1939 to Guillermo and Casimira Hijar. She graduated from Encino High School. After graduation she moved to Albuquerque and eventually went to work for General Electric, where she retired in 1999. She remained in Albuquerque, where she kept an open and loving home until her death. She was preceded in death by her parents, her infant daughter, Rose Anne Hijar, and her sister, Inez Lucero. She is survived by her daughter, Rose Marie Hijar, granddaughter, Kyra Hijar-Pizarro both of Albuquerque; her sisters Carmen Larranaga and husband Flavio of Anton Chico, NM; Arcelia Jaramillo, and Leonor Mendez, of Albuquerque; numerous nieces and nephews and cousins. Mary Ellen devoted her life to those she loved and was always there for family and friends. We always knew we could find a warm heart, a warm hug, and a warm meal at Aunties' house. She found enjoyment in keeping a welcoming home, was a devout Catholic, an avid Lobos fan, and loved music and dancing. Her greatest joy came from her family. She was a dedicated mother, grandmother (Tita), auntie, and godmother. The last few years were spent helping take care of her granddaughter, Kyra, who awoke her youthful spirit and brought her much love, pride, and delight. She was a member of St. Anne's Catholic Church, the Sacred Heart Society, the Mount Carmel Society of St. John the Baptist Catholic Church, and also served as a union representative at GE. She loved her family and friends deeply, leaving a beautiful legacy of love and service for all to follow. A loving daughter, sister, mother, grandma "Tita", Nina, Auntie, cousin, and friend, Mary Ellen will be remembered for her genuinely caring heart and compassionate soul. Services will be held at St. John the Baptist Catholic Church in Duran on Thursday, April 11, 2013. A Rosary will be recited at 10:00 a.m. followed by the funeral Mass at 11:00 a.m. Arrangements have been entrusted to Gabaldon Mortuary.

↧

↧

Obituary for GARCIA

GARCIA, ALEXANDER April 9, 1922-September 12, 1989 Your Smile Though your smile is gone forever, and your hand I cannot touch, I still have many memories of the one I loved so much. Your memory is my keepsake, with which I'll never part. God has you in His keeping, I have you in my heart. So desperately missed, but never forgotten. Happy Birthday Daddy! I love you with all my heart, and miss you so much. Love your daughter Judy and family

↧

Obituary for GARCIA

GARCIA, OLITA P. Olita left this world to join our Lord on April 7, 2013. She was born on May 22, 1925 in Lake Arthur, NM. Her parents were Rufino Padilla and Guadalupe Zamora Padilla Aldaz. She grew up in a blended family of eight siblings along with her mother and step-father, Epifano "Barney" Aldaz. Her siblings included, Perry Zamora, Lorenzo Aldaz, Isabel Aldaz, Nellie Baca, Ruby Padilla, Jack Padilla, Pat Aldaz and Joe Aldaz. Olita grew up in Lincoln County, Carrizozo, Capitan and Ft. Stanton areas. She met her husband Manuel "Manny" Garcia in 1944 in Roswell where he was stationed at the Roswell Army Airfield Base. During his off hours, Manuel played in a local orchestra while Olita would dance the night away doing the jitterbug. They married in 1945 and moved to his home town of Kingsville, Texas where he owned and operated a barbershop. Olita was unable to tolerate the humidity in Kingsville and convinced her husband to move back to New Mexico. Manual attended Highlands University graduating with a Bachelors and Master's Degree in Education and History. After which they moved to Wagon Mound, NM were they lived for six years where Manuel taught at the local High School. During the summer months, Olita attended Cosmetology School in Albuquerque. After completing school, she opened her own Beauty Salon in Wagon Mound. Olita, Manuel and family moved to Albuquerque in 1958. Manuel began teaching at Valley High School and Olita again opened her own Beauty Salon, La Mesa Beauty Shop which she owned and operated until Manuel's passing in 1985. Known for her strong work ethic and independence, Olita continued to work well into her senior years working at the Montebello Retirement Home beauty shop, Furr's Cafeteria, Melba's Dress Store and doing product demos at local grocery stores. She enjoyed spending hours each day visiting with friends and family both in person and by phone. Special people during her life included her neighbor Roger, Charmaine, Pat, Marc, Patrice, Bobbi and Joe, Joey, Gary, Lita, Clara, Betty and Dave, Margaret, Lois, Dorothy, Elvina P. and Elvina G., Bella, Jane, Ruth, Millie, Beverly and Lila, Ginger and Mac. Olita is survived by her loving family, Anna Luna, Lucy Garcia, Irene Garcia and Eric Best, Becky and Chris Horne; grandchildren, David Luna, Sarah Horne, Emily Beltramo, Jacob Horne; and great-grandchild, Ciera Luna. A Rosary will be recited on Friday, April 12, 2013, 6:00 p.m. at FRENCH - Lomas with a Visitation one hour prior. A Funeral Mass will be held Saturday, April 13, 2013, 9:00 a.m. at The Shrine of St. Bernadette Catholic Church, 11401 Indian School Road NE. Interment will follow at Gate of Heaven Cemetery. In lieu of flowers donations may be made to the Barrett House Foundation, 10300 Constitution Ave NE Albuquerque, NM 87112. Please visit our online guestbook for Olita at www.FrenchFunerals.com FRENCH - Lomas 10500 Lomas Blvd. NE (505) 275-3500

↧

Obituary for FORMEA

FORMEA, DOROTHY JUNE GOODNIGHT Age 88, a resident of Albuquerque since 1957, passed away Friday, April 5, 2013. Dorothy is survived by her husband, John; children Jim Formea and Florence of Colorado; Jeanne Ray and Troy of California; Jude Sanders and Joe of Colorado; John T. Formea and Ida of New Mexico; seven grandchildren; seven great-grandchildren; numerous nieces and nephews. Dorothy was preceded in death by her parents; step-mother; brother; and great- grandson. She was a member of Our Lady of the Assumption Catholic Church and Gamma Phi Beta Sorority. Rosary will be recited on Thursday, April 11, 2013 at 7:00 p.m. at FRENCH - Lomas. Funeral Mass will be celebrated on Friday, April 12, 2013 at 11:00 a.m. at Our Lady of the Assumption Catholic Church, Lomas and Tennessee. Interment will take place at Santa Fe National Cemetery on Monday, April 15, 2013 at 10:30 a.m. Memorial contributions may be made to Our Lady of the Assumption Catholic Church. Please visit our online guestbook for Dorothy at www.FrenchFunerals.com FRENCH - Lomas 10500 Lomas Blvd. NE (505) 275-3500

↧

Obituary for DANIS

DANIS, CHERYL JOY a resident of Rio Rancho, NM, was born on 12/13/47 in Chicago, IL., went to be with our Lord on 4/6/13. She is survived by son Jason Armstrong; her daughter-in-law Heather; and the loves of her life, her grandchildren Morgan and Brody and surrogate grandchildren Brooke and JJ Bandy; her sisters Susan and Sandra; nephews Tommy, Nick, Tim, Chris and Andy. She was past Senior Regent of Women of the Moose Chapter 2217, current Chaplin, and member of VFW Ladies Auxiliary. She was an avid sports enthusiast and master 9 ball shooter. You will always live on in our hearts, rest in peace sweet Cheri. Memorial service will be on 4/10 at 10:00am at Sagebrush Community Church. Celebration of Life will be on 4/13 at 2:00pm at the Moose Lodge in Rio Rancho. In lieu of flowers please donate to The Women of the Moose Charities.

↧

↧

Obituary for COX

COX, ROGER SHERREL Passed away on Thursday, April 5, 2013. He went peacefully surrounded by his family. Roger was born February 10, 1931 in Cortez, CO to Hendrix Candler and Elizabeth Lucretia Cox. He married Elizabeth Cannon (Dee Dee) on May 24, 1980 in the Salt Lake LDS temple. He happily served as a High Priest, in a bishopric, as Young Men's leader, and five years in the New Mexico LDS mission presidency. He loved his Tuesday mornings working at the Albuquerque New Mexico temple. Roger and Dee Dee found joy researching his family history by traveling to Tennessee, Missouri and Oklahoma, where ancestors had lived. He was raised on the Navajo reservation where he grew to love the Navajo people. He mastered the language and loved speaking to all the Navajo's he encountered. Roger graduated from Farmington high school where he was named to the Hall of Fame. He attended his beloved University of New Mexico on a football scholarship, and was inducted into the UNM Hall of Honor. He was the most loyal Lobo fan in the state of New Mexico. Roger was not only a classic example of a self-made man, but was also one of the key figures in the evolution of the New Mexico real estate business. Along with the love of work and making a deal, he enjoyed being surrounded by his family. He is survived by his wife, Dee Dee; six children, Janice (Brian) Anderson, Elizabeth Cox, Anthony (Karen) Cox, Sabrina (Jeremy) Lovejoy, Jacob (Sara) Cox, Anne Marie (Joshua) Hiatt; 16 grandchildren; two great -grandchildren; and sister, Sherrie (Tom) Diediker. Roger was preceded in death by his parents; his brother, Bart Cox and granddaughter Charlotte Miera. Roger founded Roger Cox and Associates Real Estate Brokerage, which has recently celebrated 50 years strong. He has served as President of the Realtor Association of New Mexico and was the very first realtor in New Mexico to attain the prestigious CCIM designation in 1968. He also held the title of Realtor of the year in both Albuquerque and the state of New Mexico. He was past president of RANM, the director of National Association of Realtors, state highway commissioner, past president of the UNM Lobo Club and all conference end for the University of New Mexico. An achievement of which he was very proud was being developer of PAA-KO communities and PAA-KO Ridge golf club. Roger was a guiding light in the real estate industry. He also served his country in the United States Army. There will be a viewing Wednesday, April 10, 2013 from 6:00-8:00 p.m. at the LDS San Victorio Chapel, 11750 San Victorio Ave. NE. Funeral services will be held on Thursday, April 11, 2013, at 10:30 a.m. at the San Victorio Chapel. Officiating will be Bishop Mike Davis of the East Ridge Ward. In lieu of flowers, the family requests donations to the LDS Missionary Fund., www.ldsphilanthropies. org/missionary or to the UNM Lobo Club: In care of Scholarship Fund, msco42680, 1 University of New Mexico, Albuquerque, NM 87131. Please visit our online guestbook for Roger at www.FrenchFunerals.com FRENCH - Wyoming 7121 Wyoming Blvd. NE (505) 823-9400

↧

Obituary for CARLETON

CARLETON, MARIE Eralia Marie Carleton, 85 was born on January 16, 1928 and was called home to her Maker on April 5, 2013. She will now be able to spend eternity with her true love, husband R. F. Carleton. Marie's giving nature will be missed as she has spent many years giving to the community through many organizations, such as St. Martin Hospitality Center, Casa los Ninos, Mentor Mentee programs and donating quilts to many deserving people who needed her warmth. She was preceded in death by her parents, four sisters and her husband. Marie is survived by siblings, Vi Folkins and husband Glen of Florida, Lina Johnson and husband Larry of Arizona, Molly Bridgeman and husband Glen of Arizona, Roger Amador and wife Kathy of Arizona, Sammy Amador and wife Sylvia of California, Johnny Amador and wife Bonnie of Albuquerque and Ernest Amador and wife Isabel of California; children, Glenn Carleton and wife Jo Ann of Albuquerque, Bill Carleton and wife Inge of Rio Rancho, Sylvia Carleton and Thea Yuma of Albuquerque; five grandchildren; two great-grandchildren; many nieces and nephews. In lieu of flowers, please make donations to St. Martin's Hospitality Center. Service will be held on Thursday, April 11, 2013 at Shepherd of the Valley, 1801 Montano Rd. NW. Interment to be held a Santa Fe National Cemetery on Friday, April 12, 2013 at 2:15 p.m. To view information or leave a condolence please visit www.danielsfuneral.com Daniels Family Funeral Services 3113 Carlisle Blvd NE Albuquerque, NM 87110 505-884-1188

↧

Obituary for BRUNNER

BRUNNER, MELANIE ANN Melanie, of Tesuque, NM passed away on Thursday, April 4th, after many years of bravely fighting a neurological illness under the care of her loving husband, J. Terrence Brunner. She was born in Chicago, IL, to Francis and Cecilia Marley. The family moved to Indianapolis, IN where she graduated from St. Agnes's Academy. She went on to graduate from Averett College in Danville, VA and became a flight attendant for Delta Airlines. While she was with Delta, she met and married Terry and they celebrated their 47th anniversary together last December. She lived in Winnetka for 30 years with her husband, Jules Terrence Brunner, Executive Director of the Better Government Association. Melanie loved to travel, and in 1986, after years at home being a wonderful mother, started an almost 20 year career as a manager and travel agent with the Travel 100 group in Winnetka, IL. She was active in the Junior League of Chicago as an Art Docent in the Chicago Public Schools. She Enjoyed working with the Brookefield Zoo as a Women's Board member. She was preceded in death by her father, Francis; mother, Cecilia; step-mother, Margaret; and her sister, Cynthia. She is survived by her loving and caring husband, J. Terrence Brunner of Santa Fe, NM; children, Mark, Terry and Brooke; by five wonderful grandchildren: Alex, Caroline, Audrey, Bennett and Marlo. A memorial service will be held at San Isidro Mission Church In Tesuque on May 4, 2013 at 10:00 am. In lieu of flowers, memorial contributions can be made to the Cure PSP Foundation, 11350 McCormick Road, Hunt Valley, Maryland 21031.

↧

Obituary for ARMIJO

ARMIJO, ROBERT KENNETH Age 46, of Albuquerque passed away on April 5, 2013, at home surrounded by his loving family. Robert was born in Socorro, NM, and was preceded in death by his father, Joe P. Armijo, of San Antonio, NM. Robert is survived by and is lovingly remembered by his mother, Rosemary Armijo of Albuquerque; brothers Richard Armijo of Socorro and Joseph Armijo of Albuquerque; his sister Melissa Armijo; sister-in-law Zooila Armijo; nieces Savannah Padilla and Jazmin Armijo. Robert also leaves behind a lot of loving family and friends. A memorial service is planned at Daniels Family Funeral Services at 7601 Wyoming Blvd. NE, Albuquerque, NM, Wednesday, April 10th at 5:00 p.m.

↧

↧

Obituary for WOOD

WOOD, DANA C. Passed peacefully from this life on April 5, 2013, at the age of 57. He was born in Minneapolis, MN, to his loving parents, Everett and Edna Wood. He graduated from Gallup High School. He completed B.S. and M.S. degrees in Civil Engineering from the University of New Mexico. Dana was a businessman, a private pilot, and an avid follower of motorsports. Dana's pointed humor, work ethic and uncomplaining endurance will be missed. Dana is survived by his fiancee, Lisa LaRusch; three siblings, John and Douglas in Albuquerque, and Charlene (Dolly) Delaunay in Arapahoe, WY. A memorial service will be held Saturday, April 13, 2013, at 10:00 a.m. at FRENCH- Wyoming . In lieu of flowers, please consider a donation to the University of New Mexico Cancer Center, 1201 Camino de Salud NE, Albuquerque, 87106, where Dana received care. Please visit our online guestbook for Dana at www.FrenchFunerals.com FRENCH - Wyoming 7121 Wyoming Blvd. NE (505) 823-9400

↧

Obituary for TAFOYA

TAFOYA, CLARA DOROTHY 1914 - 2013 age 98, a resident of Bosque Farms, NM passed away on Friday, April 5, 2013. She was born November 19, 1914 in Kelly, NM. She was a member of Our Lady of Guadalupe Catholic Church in Peralta, NM. Clara was a loving wife, mother and grandmother. She loved to cook and bake for her family. She loved making arts and crafts. She made a lot of nice crafts and gave them to family and friends. Clara also had a green thumb for planting. She was preceded in death by her loving husband, Melcor Tafoya; mother, Abigail Nunez; two sisters, Stella Chavez and Helen Chavez; and one brother, Dennis Nunez. Clara is survived by her two sons, Antonio Tafoya and wife, Kathy and Ben Tafoya and wife, Lupe; one daughter, Margie Zamora and husband, Pete; seven grandchildren; eight great- grandchildren; one great-great- grandchild; one brother, Julian Nunez and wife, Emma; and two sisters, Laura Geier and husband, Carl and Benina Sanchez. All services will be held at Our Lady of Guadalupe Catholic Church, on Thursday, April 11, beginning with a viewing at 10:00 a.m. with a rosary to be recited at 10:30 a.m. A Funeral Mass will be celebrated at 11:00 a.m. Interment will follow at Valencia Catholic Cemetery. Pallbearers will be Jude Tafoya, Christopher Tafoya, April Tafoya, Monique Rivera, Magdalene Romero, Adrian Zamora and Dominic Zamora. Sign Clara's online register book at www.romerofuneralhomenm.com Romero Funeral Home, 609 N. Main St., Belen, NM.

↧

Obituary for SMITH

SMITH, ELLIS FRANKLIN Passed away Sunday morning, April 7, 2013. Ellis was born on 27 Oct 1923 to Homer and Gracie in Logan Township, KS and served in the Navy during WWII. Ellis was preceded in death by his wife Phyllis, after almost 62 years of marriage. He is survived by his Sister Mary; two younger brothers John and Curtis; sons Miles and Mark; daughter Frances; along with seven grandchildren and seven (five and two on the way); and great- grandchildren. Services will be on Sunday at 2:00pm at Reflections Funerals and Life Celebrations at 2400 Washington St. NE in Albuquerque. In lieu of flowers, donations may be made to Ambercare at 420 North Main St., Belen, NM 87002.

↧
